nlp module¶

Functions for converting text documents into vector space.

nlp.get_chi(df, n, dfy, ny, alpha=0)[source]¶

Calculate chi scores for features from one topic

nlp.get_chi_explain(df, n, dfy, ny, alpha=0)[source]¶
nlp.get_co(X, diagonal=True, triangular=False, sparse=True, binary=False, dtype=None, output_dtype=None, upper_limit=0, output_len=None)[source]¶

Calculate cooccurence count from a collection of token counts.

nlp.get_co_from_coy(coy, dtype=None)[source]¶

Convert per topic cooccurence count into total cooccurence count.

nlp.get_coy(X, Y, sort=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Calculate per topic cooccurence count from a collection of token counts.

nlp.get_df(X, workers=4, token_pattern='[\\w][\\w-]*', encoding='utf8', lowercase=True, min_df=0, min_df_part=0, max_df=1.0, max_df_part=1.0, analyzer='word', tokenizer=None, preprocessor=None, decode_error='strict', stop_words=None, mp_pool=None, min_tf_doc=0, ngram_range=None, postprocessor=None, ngram_words=None)[source]¶

Calculate document frequency from a collection of text documents.

Parameters:
  • X (iterable) – Collection of text documents.
  • workers (int, default=4) –
  • token_pattern (string, default='[w][w-]*') – Regular expression denoting what constitute a “token”
  • ngram_range (tuple (lo, hi)) – The lower and upper “n” for n-grams to be extracted
  • ngram_words (iterable or None (default)) – Limit n-gram generation to cases where at least one word occurs in the provided list.
  • encoding (string or None, default='utf8') –
  • lowercase (boolean, default=True) –
  • analyzer (str {'word','char'}) – Whether the features should be made of word or character n-grams. Option ‘char’ creates character n-grams only from text inside word boundaries.
  • tokenizer (callable or None (default)) – Function which transforms text into list of tokens (before postprocessing and n-gram generation).
  • preprocessor (callable or None (default)) – Function which transforms text before tokenization.
  • postprocessor (callable or None (default)) – Function which transforms list of tokens (before n-gram generation)
  • min_df (int, default=0) –
  • min_df_part (int, default=0) –
  • min_tf_doc (int, default=0) –
  • max_df (float, default=1.0) –
  • max_df_part (float, default=1.0) –
  • decode_error (str, default='strict') –
  • stop_words (iterable or None (default)) –
  • mp_pool (multiprocessing.Pool or None (default)) – Multiprocessing pool object that will be used to parallelize execution. If none is provided a new one will be created.
nlp.get_df_from_dfy(dfy)[source]¶

Convert per topic document frequency into total document frequency.

nlp.get_df_part(kwargs)[source]¶
nlp.get_dfy(X, Y, workers=4, sort=True, mp_pool=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

nlp.get_idf(df, n, a1=1, a2=1, a3=1, min_df=0)[source]¶

Calculate inverse document frequency.

nlp.vectorize(X, vocabulary, workers=4, token_pattern='[\\w][\\w-]*', encoding='utf8', lowercase=True, analyzer='word', tokenizer=None, preprocessor=None, decode_error='strict', stop_words=None, mp_pool=None, ngram_range=None, postprocessor=None, ngram_words=None, binary=False, sparse=True, upper_limit=0, dtype=None)[source]¶

Convert a collection of text documents into a collection of token counts
